dublinCore.dc:title: 117 S333 IS: Homeowner Energy Freedom Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Sheehy (for himself, Mr. Marshall, Mr. Ricketts, Mr. Barrasso, Mr. Lankford, Mr. Schmitt, Mrs. Fischer, and Mr. Justice) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

form.official-title: To repeal certain provisions relating to taxpayer subsidies for home electrification, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Homeowner Energy Freedom Act.

paragraph.text: Section 50122 of Public Law 117–169 (42 U.S.C. 18795a; 136 Stat. 2036) (commonly known as the Inflation Reduction Act).
Section 50123 of Public Law 117–169 (42 U.S.C. 1879b; 136 Stat. 2041) (commonly known as the Inflation Reduction Act).
Section 50131 of Public Law 117–169 (136 Stat. 2041) (commonly known as the Inflation Reduction Act).

subsection.text: The unobligated balances of any amounts made available under each of the sections described in subsection (a) (as in effect on the day before the date of enactment of this Act) are rescinded.

Section 50121(c)(7) of Public Law 117–169 (42 U.S.C. 18795(c)(7); 136 Stat. 2033) (commonly known as the Inflation Reduction Act) is amended by striking , including a rebate provided under a high-efficiency electric home rebate program (as defined in section 50122(d)),.
